data.name: FaqAccessDenied
data.value: Why do I get ‘Access Denied’ and/or my file names are in green text?

data.name: FaqAccessDeniedAnswer1
data.value: AxCrypt is accessed via the right-click context menu, under the heading ‘AxCrypt’. There is also a built-in encryption in some versions of Windows, which is accessed in a similar way, but under the heading ‘Properties’, then the button ‘Advanced’ and finally the check box ‘Encrypt contents to secure data’. This encryption uses a feature called Encrypting File System, or EFS for short.

data.name: FaqAccessDeniedAnswer2
data.value: There are typically two reasons for getting ‘Access Denied’ messages. Both occur when files are either moved to a new system, or Windows is (re)installed on an existing system. One situation is a problem, the other is not.

data.name: FaqAccessDeniedAnswer3
data.value: If the file names in Windows Explorer are shown in black text, then you’re likely just having an NTFS ownership issue, and this is easily remedied. Please Google for ‘ntfs take ownership’ (without the quotes) to find suggested solutions.

data.name: FaqAccessDeniedAnswer4
data.value: If the file names in Windows Explorer are shown in green text, then you’ve inadvertently encrypted them with EFS. This might mean your files are lost. Please Google for ‘efs access denied’ for explanations and possible remedies.

data.name: FaqAccessDeniedAnswer5
data.value: EFS may in some cases be a useful feature, and can for some scenarios be a better solution than AxCrypt. However... Beware: There be Dragons!

data.name: FaqAccessDeniedAnswer6
data.value: Because of the way EFS is implemented, it is also likely to be the single most common cause of data loss in Windows environments. If you’re a computer security wizard, and have a full understanding of X.509 encryption certificates, and how the Windows Certificate Stores work and interact with user credentials, then you won’t have a problem as long as you’re careful to ensure backups of the appropriate certificates and keys. If, however, the previous sentence confuses you then you should probably not be using EFS because of the mentioned risk of data loss when moving files to a new system, or (re)installing Windows, or resetting passwords, or…

data.name: FaqAntivirusWarning
data.value: I got a warning from my antivirus software. Is AxCrypt infected?

data.name: FaqAntivirusWarningAnswer1
data.value: No, the official distribution does not intentionally contain anything that even remotely can be called malicious. It is very unlikely to be infected by anything unintentionally. Please read a lengthier blog post for details why we can make that statement.

data.name: FaqAnyoneCanDeleteFile
data.value: Anyone can still delete my secured files, why is that?

data.name: FaqAnyoneCanDeleteFileAnswer1
data.value: Securing a file with AxCrypt protects your information from prying eyes and undetected modification or corruption. It does not protect against destruction, willfully or by accident.

data.name: FaqAnyoneCanDeleteFileAnswer2
data.value: It bears repetition: Your protection against data loss is regular backups.

data.name: FaqAnyoneCanDeleteFileAnswer3
data.value: Technically it’s not really possible to reliably protect your data against destruction with software – except backup software. Of course, software can add safeguards that make it harder to do it by mistake, or even maliciously but in the end you can’t protect against vandals that way.

data.name: FaqAnyoneCanDeleteFileAnswer4
data.value: You should be using the NTFS file system and let every user of the computer sign in as a separate, restricted, user. No-one should normally run as administrator. This will protect your files against deletion by other users of the same computer, but it will not protect against yourself – or any agent acting on your behalf. Please remember that viruses and trojan intrusions will be acting as if on the behalf of the compromised user!

data.name: FaqAnyoneCanDeleteFileAnswer5
data.value: If your system is compromised by a virus or a trojan, your secured files will be protected from theft – but not from destruction.

data.name: FaqAnyoneCanDeleteFileAnswer6
data.value: AxCrypt is not intended to protect against destruction, and there is to our knowledge no such serious software available except backup software. Any software claiming to provide such protection should be examined carefully to understand exactly what it is it protects against and how. Always backup your data regardless of other measures taken.

data.name: FaqDamagedFile
data.value: My secured file is damaged, what can I do?

data.name: FaqDamagedFileAnswer1
data.value: If your secured file is corrupt, you will get a message which will refer to the HMAC being incorrect or some similar text.

data.name: FaqDamagedFileAnswer2
data.value: This message implies that the file is recognized by AxCrypt, and that you have entered the correct password and/or key file, and there is hope!

data.name: FaqDamagedFileAnswer3
data.value: Another message that may be seen will refer to the GUID being incorrect. This indicates a severe error in the file to the extent that it’s not even recognized as an AxCrypt file. In most cases this is because the file is simply not a file secured by AxCrypt.

data.name: FaqDamagedFileAnswer4
data.value: AxCrypt has some features for recovery of damaged files, but there are some limitations. You must also be careful, and start by marking the original (damaged) file as read-only, and then make a copy of it – and always only work on the copy!

data.name: FaqDamagedFileAnswer5
data.value: Please contact support for further instructions on how to proceed.

data.name: FaqDamagedFileAnswer6
data.value: Your protection against data loss is regular backups. Please backup all your important files – secured as well as files without security. AxCrypt is not intended to provide any protection against data loss – only against disclosure and undetected manipulation.

data.name: FaqDifference1&2
data.value: What is the difference between AxCrypt 1.x and 2.x?

data.name: FaqDifference1&2Answer1
data.value: AxCrypt 1.x is a legacy version. That means it is outdated and there is no longer any support for it, whereas AxCrypt 2.x is the version that we are continuously working on to keep improving it. It’s absolutely not recommended to use 1.x. We recommend all users, old and new, to always use the most current released version of AxCrypt, which can be downloaded here.

data.name: FaqDifference1&2Answer2
data.value: For users that have a specific need for the legacy downloads (usage at own risk), they can be found here.

data.name: FaqDifferenceStandaloneInstaller
data.value: What are the major differences between the standalone version and installer version of AxCrypt?

data.name: FaqDifferenceStandaloneInstallerAnswer1
data.value: The installer version comes with some additional features (e.g. context menu integration) compared to the lightweight, standalone version.

data.name: FaqDifferenceStandaloneInstallerAnswer2
data.value: The standalone version is directly executable – no installation is required. In this version, you will not get AxCrypt’s right click context in Explorer, nor will you be able to open files by double-clicking.

data.name: FaqEmailUsedFor
data.value: What will my email be used for when I sign up?

data.name: FaqEmailUsedForAnswer1
data.value: Your email will be used to name your AxCrypt ID, and will also be used as the name when authenticating against the server in order to access premium functionality. It may also be used to notify you of critical software updates, new features and other communications from us such as a newsletter. The AxCrypt ID itself will be used to allow others to share files securely with you without the need to share passwords, and for other possible future features such as enabling others to validate digital signatures. Since we offer premium features from a server based infrastructure, we need something to identify you by. Currently this is your email since it is universally available and accepted. In the future it may be some other moniker such as your mobile phone number, your government issued digital identity, your Twitter account etc.

data.name: FaqEmailUsedForAnswer2
data.value: We will not sell or use your email for third party communications without your explicit consent.

data.name: FaqEmailUsedForAnswer3
data.value: Please see the terms of use for more details.

data.name: FaqFileEncryptionNotWorking
data.value: File Encryption for .NET and Mono has stopped working

data.name: FaqFileEncryptionNotWorkingAnswer1
data.value: If you get an error message “File Encryption for .NET and Mono has stopped working. A problem caused the program to stop working correctly. Windows will close the program and notify you if a solution is available.” the most likely cause is a software called “Lavasoft Web Companion”. This is not compatible with modern versions of Windows, and it modifies the way the network is accessed in a way that causes AxCrypt and other programs to crash.

data.name: FaqFileEncryptionNotWorkingAnswer2
data.value: Check if you have Lavasoft Web Companion installed, and uninstall it if this is the case. If you’re still having the same problem or do not have the Lavasoft software installed, please follow the instructions and file a full error report.

data.name: FaqForgotPassword
data.value: I forgot my password. What to do?

data.name: FaqForgotPasswordAnswer1
data.value: The basic rule is: If you lose or forget your password or key-file, your documents are lost. There is no back-door into AxCrypt.

data.name: FaqForgotPasswordAnswer2
data.value: The only way to recover a lost password is to try all likely combinations.

data.name: FaqForgotPasswordAnswer3
data.value: All that being said, there is a special case where we could possibly help you. If you think you know your password, but not quite, or if it’s less than 5 characters long – then we can write and adapt a special program that will try many combinations automatically. This is called a brute force attack.

data.name: FaqForgotPasswordAnswer4
data.value: AxCrypt is specifically engineered to counter brute force attacks, and does it rather well, so this will only work when the number of combinations to try is very small, let’s say less than a million.

data.name: FaqForgotPasswordAnswer5
data.value: If you think you may be in a position where you can narrow down the possible combinations enough for us, then there is a slight chance to recover the password using a utility that will attempt to try many possibilities according to a pattern you provide. Please contact support if would like to try the brute force utility.

data.name: FaqHowLargeFileSupport
data.value: How are large files supported?

data.name: FaqHowLargeFileSupportAnswer1
data.value: AxCrypt is only limited by available hard disk space.

data.name: FaqHowManyPassesWipe
data.value: How many passes does wipe do/Why only one pass wiping?

data.name: FaqHowManyWipeAnswer1
data.value: Wipe and Delete only overwrites once with pseudo random data. We’re currently not planning to implement DoD 5220.22 (NISPOM) sanitization, nor Gutmann 35-pass secure-wipe. The cost of retrieving single-overwritten data is prohibitive as it is. If the attacker has the resources for that (as well as getting physical access to the disk) there are many easier and surer ways of getting at the data.

data.name: FaqHowManyWipeAnswer2
data.value: A PC is such an insecure and uncontrolled environment, that to use DoD-style wiping in a running system is severe overkill and misleading. Such wiping should be used prior to destruction or re-use of hard disks, and then only from a stand-alone diskette and CD so that the entire disk surface may be wiped, regardless of operating system structures. We recommend Boot and Nuke for this purpose.

data.name: FaqHowManyWipeAnswer3
data.value: The purpose of AxCrypt wiping is to protect from use of common undelete tools, not to protect from electron microscopy or special diagnostic hardware and software available to hard disc manufacturers. Wiping 35 times also takes a lot of time...

data.name: FaqHowToRenew
data.value: How do I renew my subscription?

data.name: FaqHowToRenewAnswer1
data.value: New subscribers have a subscription that will automatically renew at the end of the subscription period, using the initial payment method. To check your subscription status, login to the account site, and check it on the My AxCrypt ID page. You will see the date it renews on there.

data.name: FaqHowToRenewAnswer2
data.value: If it mentions that the subscription will expire on a certain date, you either subscribed before June 25th 2020, or you cancelled your automatic payments. In that case, you will have to renew it yourself.

data.name: FaqKeysAndPasswords
data.value: Do you have keys and passwords on your servers?

data.name: FaqKeysAndPasswordsAnswer1
data.value: Yes, but encrypted with your password which we do not store. There is no essential change in the security compared to previous versions. You must still use a strong password, and keep it secret.

data.name: FaqKeysAndPasswordsAnswer2
data.value: The only thing that must be secret with AxCrypt is your password. Nothing else, not the software, not the secured files, not the secured account keys or anything else. As long as your password is both strong and secret, your secured files remain secure. Even if our server would be compromised, the permanently stored sensitive data stored there is encrypted with your password, which we do not store.

data.name: FaqLinkLabel
data.value: FAQ

data.name: FaqPasswordRecoveryCorporate
data.value: Does AxCrypt support password recovery for corporate use?

data.name: FaqPasswordRecoveryCorporateAnswer1
data.value: If you represent a company thinking about using AxCrypt, you may be worried about the case of an employee quitting and not telling the password to his or her files. The question then is if you can set a password recovery policy?

data.name: FaqPasswordRecoveryCorporateAnswer2
data.value: If an employee quits, and refuses to give back company property your response should be to report the person to the police for theft, and/or take other legal action. This applies just as much to his laptop as the intellectual property owned by the company which is stored on the laptop or the company servers.

data.name: FaqPasswordRecoveryCorporateAnswer3
data.value: There are enterprise solutions that do implement functionality like this, but the most common reason to use AxCrypt is because of it’s simplicity to implement. Enterprise solutions demand quite a bit of infrastructure, maintenance and can be quite complex to install. Unfortunately, enterprise solutions do not really protect against disgruntled (ex-) employees anyway, although they do provide protection against accidental password loss.

data.name: FaqPasswordRecoveryCorporateAnswer4
data.value: So, AxCrypt is kept simple to use and deploy, at the cost of no password recovery. Data loss concerns should be addressed via backup procedures of both passwords and data, and issues with employees leaving without divulging passwords should be treated as any other destructive or illegal behavior by such a person.

data.name: FaqSignInWithoutPassword
data.value: How do I sign in when I have an existing account I don’t know the password for?

data.name: FaqSignInWithoutPasswordAnswer1
data.value: If you’ve just downloaded AxCrypt 2, entered your email and gotten a message that you already have an account, but don’t know the password, you need to issue a password reset. Click on the link and follow the instructions. If you’re already using a strong password for your AxCrypt files, you should consider using that as your account password.

data.name: FaqStopFromSecuring
data.value: How can I stop anyone from securing my files?

data.name: FaqStopFromSecuringAnswer1
data.value: Short answer: You can’t. Follow-up question: Why would you want to?

data.name: FaqStopFromSecuringAnswer2
data.value: If you install AxCrypt, anyone with access to your computer can secure your files. This is sometimes seen as a risk with installing AxCrypt. However, this is not the case. The real risk is with ‘…anyone with access to your computer’. Anyone who can access your computer and run an installed copy of AxCrypt, can also install AxCrypt or any other security or deletion software. Anyone who can access your computer can delete your files, and probably format your hard disk. Anyone with physical access can also throw it out the window, steal it, use it for target practice with a shotgun or any other activity that may prove detrimental to the health of your files.

data.name: FaqStopFromSecuringAnswer3
data.value: The point is that it makes no sense to restrict access to AxCrypt – it’s the access to the computer that needs to be restricted! That’s why you should always use a password protected screen saver and always have a password on your account. Because then, if your files are secured with AxCrypt, your information will stay safe even in the face of loss or theft of your computer or media with the files on.

data.name: FaqWhatHappensExpire
data.value: What happens when my subscription expires?

data.name: FaqWhatHappensExpireAnswer1
data.value: If you stop subscribing to Premium or Business, you will fall back to the Viewer or Free plan after the end of your subscription period. You won’t have to worry about your files, because you’ll never get locked out of your data.

data.name: FaqWhatHappensExpireAnswer2
data.value: With the Windows version, your files will be re-encrypted with 128-bit AES encryption, rather than the 256-bit AES algorithm that was used when you were on a subscription. If you are using AxCrypt on macOS, you will be unable to encrypt new files. You can still decrypt and view the encrypted files. The content of encrypted files can’t be updated. That means you have to either decrypt them, or get a paid subscription to keep using AxCrypt like before.

data.name: FaqWhatPlatforms
data.value: What platforms does AxCrypt run on?

data.name: FaqWhatPlatformsAnswer1
data.value: AxCrypt is currently available on most major platforms, including: Windows, MacOS, iOS and Android. For more information about platforms and system requirements, head over to Requirements.

data.name: FaqWhyPasswordSignIn
data.value: Why does AxCrypt only ask for a password during sign-in? Isn’t that insecure?

data.name: FaqWhyPasswordSignInAnswer1
data.value: While you are signed in to AxCrypt, offline or online, AxCrypt will not ask you again for the same password. This feature makes usage of AxCrypt much more convenient, and saves you from the trouble of re-entering the password every time.

data.name: FaqWhyPasswordSignInAnswer2
data.value: Security is a chain only as strong as its weakest link. In your local system, there are so many other ways to get at your data that to sacrifice the convenience of a password cache just to ‘feel’ safer, was not thought to be a good idea.

data.name: FaqWhyPasswordSignInAnswer3
data.value: But what’s then the use of AxCrypt if anyone can walk up to my PC and just double-click?

data.name: FaqWhyPasswordSignInAnswer4
data.value: Under the heading Documentation > Security > Local PC Security you will find a discussion about what is needed to protect your PC locally, and why. The important thing for this discussion is: If anyone can walk up to your PC and it’s not protected by a password-protected screen-saver you have no protection anyway! All that is needed for a would-be attacker is access to a PC with for example a diskette or CD-drive, a USB-port or an Internet connection, and it’s a few seconds work to install a keylogger or a trojan. Do not trust a PC that has been left unattended and unprotected.

data.name: FaqWhyPasswordSignInAnswer5
data.value: The second reason for the password cache is that if you do not need to enter it every time, you may actually find it reasonable to use a longer and stronger password than otherwise, thus increasing security.

data.name: FaqWhyPasswordSignInAnswer6
data.value: If you are concerned about physical access to your own computer there are other measures you should take first. If you want to, you can always sign out from AxCrypt when leaving your computer.

data.name: FaqWhySecure
data.value: Why secure files with strong encryption?

data.name: FaqWhySecureAnswer1
data.value: Why do you need encryption in order to secure your files? In two words: privacy and confidentiality.

data.name: FaqWhySecureAnswer2
data.value: As private persons, we nowadays store lots of information on our computers that is not necessarily secret, but just simply private. Many of us also at times have the need to use employer-owned computers and servers, as well as public servers, to store such information. It might be copies of electronic invoices, private letters, your CV etc.

data.name: FaqWhySecureAnswer3
data.value: In all these situations you might feel a little more comfortable knowing that regardless of physical access to the files by network administrators, service personnel or even other family members in your home network, your private information is still kept private.

data.name: FaqWhySecureAnswer4
data.value: As employees we frequently are responsible for information that is sensitive in various ways. It might be salaries if you’re a manager, or customer data if you’re in sales or support etc. This information is kept in confidence by you, and you have a responsibility to care for it as best you can.

data.name: FaqWhySecureAnswer5
data.value: In many cases it’s not really enough to just store it on the corporate network server and apply appropriate restrictive access permissions. The information and files are still always available to support staff, network administrators etc. Even if you trust your colleagues, as you should, mistakes do happen and sometimes it’s simply human to be curious. Anyone finding a file with his or her name on it will be sorely tempted to sneak a peek…

data.name: FaqWhySecureAnswer6
data.value: Finally, there are an increasing number of cases where legislation and similar rules come into play such as the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act, HIPAA, where encryption of confidential data is required under certain circumstances.

data.name: FaqWhySecureAnswer7
data.value: In these and similar situations encryption programs such as AxCrypt provide a secure and convenient method to provide privacy and confidentiality as appropriate.

data.name: FaqWhyTimeStap
data.value: Why is the file time-stamp set to the time of securing the file?

data.name: FaqWhyTimeStapAnswer1
data.value: The default operation of AxCrypt when securing a plain-text file, is to store the original files time-stamps inside the secured file and to set the time-stamps of the resulting secured file to the time when it was most recently secured. The rationale for this behavior is as follows:

data.name: FaqWhyTimeStapAnswer2
data.value: Many backup and file-synchronization software programs depend on the modification time of files to determine if it has been modified since the last run. This test fails, if the secured file retains the original date of the plain-text file and at worst the file does not get copied/backed up etc.

data.name: FaqWhyTimeStapAnswer3
data.value: Good security software will ensure that securing the same file twice produces completely different secured files, to make it harder to determine if the file is the same as another file, or another earlier version of a file. If the time-stamp is retained, an attacker will get a high-precision time-stamp that more or less uniquely identifies each and every file thus leaking what might be important information about the file. (File size will remain the same, since the securing is deterministic, but this is a much weaker assertion).

data.name: FaqWhyTimeStapAnswer4
data.value: Semantically, securing a file is a transformation of the file, and this should be reflected in the time-stamp. Note that the original plain-text time-stamps still will be restored if the security is removed from the file!

data.name: FaqWhyTimeStapAnswer5
data.value: If AxCrypt ever should support multi-file archives, there’s no choice but to use the time of securing it, otherwise it’ll make it very inconsistent – which time-stamp should a multi-file AxCrypt archive which happens to contain exactly one file use (which by the way is the case today, the file format supports multiple files, but AxCrypt has not implemented this functionality yet).

data.name: GdprBlock1Heading
data.value: What is the GDPR?

data.name: GdprBlock1Text1
data.value: The EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a binding legislative act concerning the protection of personal data and individual rights. The GDPR replaces the Data Protection Directive 95/46/EC.

data.name: GdprBlock1Text2
data.value: It was designed to harmonize data privacy laws across Europe, to protect and empower all EU citizens data privacy and to reshape the way organizations approach data privacy. The GDPR requires companies to implement reasonable ways to protect their data, such as encryption, to protect it against data loss or exposure.

data.name: GdprBlock1Text3
data.value: The enforcement date of the GDPR is 25 May 2018.

data.name: GdprBlock2Heading
data.value: Who is affected by it?

data.name: GdprBlock2Text1
data.value: The GDPR applies to all organizations located within the EU, or outside of the EU, processing and holding the personal data of EU citizens, in order to: offer goods or services, or monitor their behaviour within the EU.

data.name: GdprBlock3Heading
data.value: How can file encryption help towards compliance?

data.name: GdprBlock3Text1
data.value: As Recital 83 in the GDPR states:

data.name: GdprBlock3Text2
data.value: ”In order to maintain security and to prevent processing in infringement of this Regulation, the controller or processor should evaluate the risks inherent in the processing and implement measures to mitigate those risks, such as encryption.”

data.name: GdprBlock3Text3
data.value: Organizations have to make sure that their personal data is stored securely, whether on-premise or cloud-based, in order to prevent costly data breaches. Files that have been encrypted will be rendered useless when breached.

data.name: GdprBlock4Heading
data.value: What are the penalties for non-compliance?

data.name: GdprBlock4Text1
data.value: Organizations can be fined up to 4% of annual global turnover for breaching GDPR or €20 Million – whichever is greater. This is the maximum fine that can be imposed for the most serious infringements. It is important to note that these rules apply to both controllers and processors – meaning ‘clouds’ will not be exempt from GDPR enforcement.

data.name: GdprBlock5Heading
data.value: How does the GDPR handle personal data breaches?

data.name: GdprBlock5Text1
data.value: In the case of a personal data breach, the controller shall without undue delay and, where feasible, not later than 72 hours after having become aware of it, notify the personal data breach to the supervisory authority.

data.name: GdprBlock6Heading
data.value: What are my main responsibilities under the GDPR?

data.name: GdprBlock6Text1
data.value: If your organization handles personal data, the Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO) states that you are expected to put into place comprehensive but proportionate governance measures. These measures should minimize the risk of breaches and uphold the protection of personal data. The exact responsibilities that apply are different for every organization, depending on its size, industry and what kind of data is being stored.

data.name: GdprBlock7Heading
data.value: Is my website GDPR compliant?

data.name: GdprBlock7Text1
data.value: According to vpnMentor as little as 34% of websites in the EU are currently GDPR compliant. “Most of the websites either have old privacy policies, and in some cases no privacy policy at all, and are in no way ready for the stricter privacy guidelines.”

data.name: GdprBlock7Text2
data.value: In order to determine which websites collect data, and therefore need to update their privacy policy, vpnMentor based their research on sites that use MailChimp to collect user Email addresses. They have collected as many 100 websites per country, and looked at their privacy policy, if they had one, to determine if it was GDPR compliant.

data.name: GdprBlock8Heading
data.value: How will Brexit impact the GDPR? Will it apply to businesses in the UK?

data.name: GdprBlock8Text1
data.value: If your business is located in the UK, it will also have to comply with the EU regulation. The UK has stated that it will comply with the GDPR, and that its compliance will not be affected by Brexit.

data.name: GdprBlock9Heading
data.value: Where can I find more reliable information on the GDPR?

data.name: GdprBlock9LinkLabel1
data.value: Read and download the complete Regulations

data.name: GdprBlock9LinkLabel2
data.value: EU’s GDPR dedicated website

data.name: GdprBlock9LinkLabel3
data.value: Summary of the articles

data.name: GdprHeading
data.value: EU General Data Protection Regulation

data.name: GetStartedInfoNote1ListItem1
data.value: In order to use AxCrypt you will need to create an account.

data.name: GetStartedInfoNote1ListItem2
data.value: If you are upgrading from a previous version of AxCrypt, you may need to restart your computer.

data.name: GetStartedInfoNote1ListItem3
data.value: Verify that the download is undamaged and authentic by checking the digital signature. Right-click the downloaded file in Windows Explorer, and select ‘Properties’ and the ‘Digital Signatures’ tab. Then select the digital signature and click ‘Details’. Ensure that the digital signature is shown as ‘OK’ and that the signer is ‘AxCrypt AB’.

This may cause some operations to take very long time. Please be careful not to select a folder with folders below that should not be encrypted.

data.name: IndustriesAboutLinkLabel
data.value: About Industries

data.name: IndustriesBenefitsTitle
data.value: Benefits of using Axcrypt

data.name: IndustriesBlogLabel
data.value: New to encryption? Check out our blog for the latest news.

data.name: IndustriesEducationCloud
data.value: Manage your data simply. Group projects and presentations can be run smoothly as the content can be accessed by anyone and anywhere on different devices thanks to our cloud storage awareness.

data.name: IndustriesEducationDescription
data.value: Online classes and digital teaching are thriving. The use of digital devices such as computers or tablets during classes, lectures or online meetings is more and more recurrent. By taking notes or commenting on PDF documents, a large amount of data is accumulated. AxCrypt helps protect private information when storing work and research under the form of files and documents. We make sure that you and only your accredited team can access your private data.

data.name: IndustriesEducationHeading
data.value: Encrypt proprietary essays, papers, reports, theses and research

data.name: IndustriesEducationParagraph
data.value: Access all your documents and synchronize them on your devices while protecting your files from costly data breaches.

data.name: IndustriesEducationProtection
data.value: AxCrypt ensures your organization stays compliant with regulations like the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

data.name: IndustriesEducationSecurity
data.value: Secure your intellectual property and important documents before uploading them. Essays, papers, reports, thesis and research results can be encrypted with Axcrypt and protected against data leaks.

data.name: IndustriesEducationTeamwork
data.value: Collaborate and share content with your classmates, professors and supervisors in a secure and uncomplicated way. Use master key, a feature which enables business administrators to recover files of the business members, eliminating the risk of losing access to critical files due to employees leaving or forgetting their passwords.

data.name: IndustriesFinancialCloud
data.value: The volume of data traffic has significantly increased. Information travels regularly to different network domains, as consumer banking relies on different endpoints to interact and has adopted a multi-cloud environment. Access all your documents and synchronize them on your devices while protecting your files from costly data breaches.

data.name: IndustriesFinancialDescription
data.value: In the world of finance, data security is a serious business. Encryption enables various types of economic activities that would otherwise not be possible. The financial services industry is one hit hardest by the heightened expectations of consumers to access information, receive help, and conduct transactions anywhere and at any time via their electronic devices. By converting plaintext into ciphertext, encryption helps banks, insurance companies, actors in the credit market, corporations, venture funds, investment advisors, fund managers, consulting firms, etc. protect sensitive information so only the authorized users can, with the right key, decrypt and understand the information.

data.name: IndustriesFinancialHeading
data.value: Safeguard highly sensitive financial information

data.name: IndustriesFinancialParagraph
data.value: With AxCrypt encryption, client’s information and company deals are stored safe and secure from prying eyes.

data.name: IndustriesFinancialProtection
data.value: Compliant with domestic and international regulations that companies should and must need, it bypasses breaches every time the market fluctuates, displays company’s relevant information when internal controls occur as only approved individuals have access to it and sidestep the considerable fines associated with non-compliance.

data.name: IndustriesFinancialSecurity
data.value: Client’s information and company deals are also stored safe and secure from prying eyes.

data.name: IndustriesFinancialTeamwork
data.value: The exchange of a large amount of data is simple and easy. It assures the security of electronic commerce transactions over the Internet for example making it possible to transmit credit card numbers. Use master key, a feature which enables business administrators to recover files of the business members, eliminating the risk of losing access to critical files due to employees leaving or forgetting their passwords.

data.name: IndustriesGovernmentCloud
data.value: Automatically secure your files/documents on multiple cloud storage services such as Google Drive and Dropbox and manage the access to your passwords seamlessly wherever you are. All information is available to all members involved in the administrational system.

data.name: IndustriesGovernmentDescription
data.value: Law enforcement officials point to the widespread and increasing use of encryption. One of its roles is to protect privacy and civil liberties. Encryption prevents the theft of information, thus helping make society more secure and safe. As a government you can rely on AxCrypt to counter threats from a wide range of actors, including unsophisticated and sophisticated criminals, foreign intelligence agencies, and repressive governments. The NSA uses AES to encrypt data, which ought to be proof enough of its security.

data.name: IndustriesGovernmentHeading
data.value: Preserve electronically archived confidential documents

data.name: IndustriesGovernmentParagraph
data.value: Encryption prevents the theft of information, thus helping make society more secure and safe. Law enforcement officials point to the widespread and increasing use of encryption.

data.name: IndustriesGovernmentProtection
data.value: AxCrypt ensures your organization stays compliant with regulations like the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

data.name: IndustriesGovernmentSecurity
data.value: With our 128-bit or 256-bit encryption, AxCrypt increases data security and reduces risks of breaches by implementing a user-friendly and easy to use encryption software.

data.name: IndustriesGovernmentTeamwork
data.value: AxCrypt allows secured files to be opened by other AxCrypt users with their own password. Exchanging encrypted information is easy, fast and riskless. Use master key, a feature which enables business administrators to recover files of the business members, eliminating the risk of losing access to critical files due to employees leaving or forgetting their passwords.

data.name: IndustriesHeadingCloud
data.value: Cloud storage awareness and password management

data.name: IndustriesHeadingConfidentiality
data.value: Confidentiality and integrity

data.name: IndustriesHeadingProtection
data.value: Data protection regulation compliant

data.name: IndustriesHeadingSecurity
data.value: Security, reliability and simplicity

data.name: IndustriesHeadingTeamwork
data.value: Teamwork, collaboration

data.name: IndustriesHealthcareCloud
data.value: Automatically secure your files/documents on multiple cloud storage services such as Google Drive and Dropbox and manage the access to your passwords seamlessly wherever you are. All information is available to all members involved in treating the patients.

data.name: IndustriesHealthcareDescription
data.value: The need of encryption has become more prevalent in hospitals, nursing homes and rehabilitation facilities. With the rapid increase in the number of practices using electronic health records such as EMRs, transmitting patient healthcare information by email including insurance information, proper dosage amounts for medicine, and other personal information, this is the digital age of healthcare and sensitive information needs a high level of security. AxCrypt offers an easy and frictionless user experience for employees, patients and business associates.

data.name: IndustriesHealthcareHeading
data.value: Secure personal identifiable information and health records

data.name: IndustriesHealthcareParagraph
data.value: Remain compliant with local and federal data protection regulations while building trust between your institution and potential patients.

data.name: IndustriesHealthcareProtection
data.value: Compliant with data protection laws, we help build trust between your institution and potential patients, safeguarding online appointments, communications with a medical professional and health records sent between institutions. AxCrypt ensures your organization stays compliant with regulations like the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), the Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health Act (HITECH) and the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

data.name: IndustriesHealthcareSecurity
data.value: Encryption prevents costly data breaches. If criminals gain access to a removable device, mobile device, or laptop that has sensitive information, your facility may be penalized with huge fines. Including encryption as part of an overall data security program allows financial improvements and helps organizations avoid the cost of security breaches.

data.name: IndustriesHealthcareTeamwork
data.value: Healthcare organizations collect, manage and distribute an enormous amount of medical and personal records. Encryption makes data more secure, whether it’s being transported or at rest. In short, it protects patients’ sensitive medical information from thefts and data breaches. Exchanging information between doctors, nurses and specialists is easy, fast and riskless. Use master key, a feature which enables business administrators to recover files of the business members, eliminating the risk of losing access to critical files due to employees leaving or forgetting their passwords.

data.name: IndustriesHeroButton
data.value: Discover AxCrypt Business

data.name: IndustriesHeroText0
data.value: We change the way people communicate and work.

data.name: IndustriesHeroText1
data.value: We change the way people communicate and work. With our 256-bit encryption, AxCrypt increases data security and reduces risks of breaches by implementing a user-friendly and easy to use encryption software and safeguarding confidentiality and integrity. Increase your productivity and stop wondering about your online privacy. Take back full control of your data and experience digital trust. Curious about encryption and related topics, have a look at our weekly updated <a href="/blog">blogs</a >. Here at AxCrypt, we are happy to assist you and answer any questions you might have about encryption.

data.name: IndustriesHeroText2
data.value: Feel free to contact us at support@axcrypt.net and don’t forget to follow us on social media.

data.name: IndustriesLegalCloud
data.value: Automatically secure your files/documents on multiple cloud storage services such as Google Drive and Dropbox and manage the access to your passwords seamlessly wherever you are. All information is available to all members involved in the agreements and contracts.

data.name: IndustriesLegalConfidentiality
data.value: Use master key, a feature which enables business administrators to recover files of the business members, eliminating the risk of losing access to critical files due to employees leaving or forgetting their passwords.

data.name: IndustriesLegalDescription
data.value: More than ever before, personal and confidential information is transmitted over the Internet in clear text and potentially exposed. The legal industry is one hit hardest by the heightened expectations of consumers to access information, receive help, and conduct agreements anywhere and at any time via their electronic devices. Whether you are a solo practitioner in criminal law or an in-house corporate attorney at a Fortune 500 company, encryption affects many of the issues you encounter, whether you realize it or not.

data.name: IndustriesLegalHeading
data.value: Protect classified contracts, wills and records

data.name: IndustriesLegalParagraph
data.value: Encryption is absolutely necessary when storing and sharing sensitive information in order to evade unauthorised and illegal processing of personal data. Reduce the risks of breaches by implementing a user-friendly and easy to use encryption software.

data.name: IndustriesLegalProtection
data.value: AxCrypt ensures your organization stays compliant with regulations like the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

data.name: IndustriesLegalSecurity
data.value: Contracts, wills and records contain classified material personal to clients and partners and therefore must be protected from leaks and hackers. Encryption may be used to authenticate and prove that a document is an original that has not been changed. Digital signatures are a perfect archetype of this use. Companies that haven’t exemplified their system with encryption have recently suffered major data breaches resulting in high profile litigation. Damages can be massive and additional losses can include credit monitoring for all customers, years of systemic and obtrusive audits to identify the leak source and data theft and destruction of files, servers, and storage systems. With our 256-bit encryption, AxCrypt increases data security and reduces risks of breaches by implementing a user-friendly and easy to use encryption software.

data.name: IndustriesLegalTeamwork
data.value: Enhance collaboration inside the team and share all types of documents with no risks. Legal firms not only need to engage in digital transformation but to also do so securely. AxCrypt allows secured files to be opened by other AxCrypt users with their own password. Exchanging excrypted information is easy, fast and riskless.

data.name: IndustriesLinkLabel
data.value: Industries

data.name: IndustriesStatistic1
data.value: clients worldwide

data.name: IndustriesStatistic2
data.value: PCMag Editors' Choice

data.name: IndustriesStatistic3
data.value: user downloads

data.name: IndustriesStatistic4
data.value: languages available

data.name: IndustriesTechCloud
data.value: Automatically secure your files/documents on multiple cloud storage services such as Google Drive and Dropbox and manage the access to your passwords seamlessly wherever you are. All information is available to all members involved in treating the patients.

data.name: IndustriesTechConfidentiality
data.value: Use master key, a feature which enables business administrators to recover files of the business members, eliminating the risk of losing access to critical files due to employees leaving or forgetting their passwords.

data.name: IndustriesTechDescription
data.value: In a world where every aspect of our everyday life is highly digital, an urgent need of privacy and trust arises, especially after experimenting with data breaches. The​ tools and services you use every day are​ ​neither​ ​open, secure​ ​nor​ ​private.​ ​Location of your data and how they are stored and processed are too often managed in a dubious and shady way. AxCrypt ​strives​ ​to​ ​build​ ​a​ ​future​ ​that​ ​respects​ everyone's ​privacy. With our zero-knowledge encryption software and a key that only belongs to you and remains on your device, nobody else can access your data.

data.name: IndustriesTechHeading
data.value: Increase data security with 128-bit or 256-bit encryption

data.name: IndustriesTechParagraph
data.value: With our 128-bit or 256-bit encryption, AxCrypt increases data security and reduces risks of breaches by implementing a user-friendly and easy to use encryption software.

data.name: IndustriesTechProtection
data.value: Adopting encryption is an excellent step for tech-services firms, as it adds security and the ability to comply with a growing number of regulations. Especially since the volume and percentage of encrypted data will only continue to grow.

data.name: IndustriesTechSecurity
data.value: End-to-end encryption is one of the best, most efficient and most practical ways of ensuring that customers’ data is secured from anyone, including the tech companies themselves, so nobody other than the owner can access it. Security and productivity are glued to one another. It is equally important that visibility across the security infrastructure doesn’t compromise performance and accordingly decrease productivity. With our 128-bit or 256-bit encryption, AxCrypt increases data security and reduces risks of breaches by implementing a user-friendly and easy to use encryption software.

data.name: IndustriesTechTeamwork
data.value: Nowadays, the lack of transparency and clarity and how big corporations handle data turns into data chaos and brings deep complexity and inefficiencies for businesses. Your private information ends up being tracked and cripeled. With AxCrypt we ensure an absolute privacy-safe work environment and strengthen trust within your community and beyond. Welcome to a new digital world. Your data is fully encrypted on our platform, so even if our servers are hacked no one could read your data. We are compliant to the GDPR and work constantly on implementing workflows and processes related to encryption and handle data under the Swedish Privacy Laws. AxCrypt allows secured files to be opened by other AxCrypt users with their own password. Exchanging excrypted information is easy, fast and riskless.

data.name: IndustriesTitle
data.value: Industries

data.name: InformationTitle
data.value: Information
data.comment: A dialog box title for general announcement and informative message dialog boxes

data.name: InternetNotRequiredInformation
data.value:
Internet is NOT REQUIRED to use AxCrypt.
Internet access is recommended, and required to enable paid subscription plans. Some features work better and critical updates may not reach you otherwise.
Your password is not stored on our servers, and the connection is always encrypted.

data.name: InterviewsLabel
data.value: Interviews

data.name: Introduction1MailSubject
data.value: Welcome to AxCrypt!

data.name: Introduction1MailText1
data.value: Thank you for choosing AxCrypt!

data.name: Introduction1MailText10
data.value: World's Best Encryption Software

data.name: Introduction1MailText11
data.value: AxCrypt has been awarded the "The World's Best Encryption Software" by PC Magazine for the past six years, including this year, with a global presence of over 20 million downloads.

data.name: Introduction1MailText12
data.value: Read more

data.name: Introduction1MailText13
data.value: With our 256-bit encryption, we make sure that no one ever gets access to your encrypted files, as long as you have control of your own key. Take a look at some of the features that might benefit you if you are using a Business or Premium subscription.

data.name: Introduction1MailText14
data.value: Cloud storage

data.name: Introduction1MailText15
data.value: AxCrypt makes it easy to accomplish data privacy in the cloud. AxCrypt will automatically find what Cloud Storage services are installed on your computer and create an AxCrypt folder there.

data.name: Introduction1MailText16
data.value: Read more

data.name: Introduction1MailText17
data.value: Master key

data.name: Introduction1MailText18
data.value: The master key is one of the significant features which eliminates the risk of losing access to critical files. This feature is available for Business subscriptions only.

data.name: Introduction1MailText19
data.value: Read more

data.name: Introduction1MailText2
data.value: Not sure where to begin? Don't worry. To make sure you get the most out of using AxCrypt, we are here for you.

data.name: Introduction1MailText20
data.value: Key sharing

data.name: Introduction1MailText21
data.value: With the key sharing feature, AxCrypt allows secured files to be opened by other AxCrypt users with their own passwords.

data.name: Introduction1MailText22
data.value: Password manager

data.name: Introduction1MailText23
data.value: With the AxCrypt password manager feature you can store all your passwords and codes in our cloud in a secure manner.

data.name: Introduction1MailText24
data.value: With AxCrypt, you can avoid becoming a victim of a cyberattack.

data.name: Introduction1MailText25
data.value: Check out our industry page to see how we serve different industries and what they say about us: https://www.axcrypt.net/industries

data.name: Introduction1MailText26
data.value: Read our latest blog post for more information on how to keep your data safe: https://www.axcrypt.net/blog

data.name: Introduction1MailText27
data.value: Contact us at support@axcrypt.net if you have any questions!

data.name: Introduction1MailText28
data.value: Follow Us on Our Social Media

data.name: Introduction1MailText3
data.value: Here is a guide for you to get started!

data.name: Introduction1MailText4
data.value: Watch our tutorials that will help you get going faster. They cover how to complete your set up process, key features of your account, plus some super handy tips.

data.name: Introduction1MailText5
data.value: Take a glance at our blog posts for more information on how to keep your data safe: https://www.axcrypt.net/blog

data.name: Introduction1MailText6
data.value: Check out our industry page to see how we serve different industries and what they say about us: https://www.axcrypt.net/industries

data.name: Introduction1MailText7
data.value: About us

data.name: Introduction1MailText8
data.value: Our mission is to provide individuals, small teams, enterprises, and companies with encryption solutions that are easier to use than ever before. By introducing new features, we aim to eliminate the complexity from the usage of strong and proven cryptographic technology.

data.name: Introduction1MailText9
data.value: Learn more

data.name: Introduction2MailSubject
data.value: Get more out of AxCrypt!

data.name: Introduction2MailText1
data.value: Hello AxCrypt user!

data.name: Introduction2MailText10
data.value: AxCrypt makes it easy to accomplish data privacy in the cloud. AxCrypt will automatically find what Cloud Storage services are installed on your computer and create an AxCrypt folder there.

data.name: Introduction2MailText11
data.value: Read More

data.name: Introduction2MailText12
data.value: Mobile encryption

data.name: Introduction2MailText13
data.value: AxCrypt's mobile encryption supports Google Drive file encryption on iOS and Android. Local Storage encryption and other cloud drives, such as iCloud, DropBox, OneDrive, etc. will be supported soon in the upcoming releases

data.name: Introduction2MailText14
data.value: Key sharing

data.name: Introduction2MailText15
data.value: With the key sharing feature, users can send an encrypted file via email, which means that the file can only be accessed with a unique key. For more information check our tutorial on YouTube.

data.name: Introduction2MailText16
data.value: Password Manager

data.name: Introduction2MailText17
data.value: With the AxCrypt password manager feature you can store all your passwords and codes in our cloud in a secure manner that no one but you can access.

data.name: Introduction2MailText18
data.value: Why is it more necessary than ever to get encrypted in 2021?

data.name: Introduction2MailText19
data.value: Since the start of the pandemic, there has been a 300% increase in reported cybercrimes around the world.

data.name: Introduction2MailText2
data.value: We hope you're enjoying AxCrypt! Do you know that the AxCrypt Business and Premium subscriptions provide a lot more data protection features and also helps in building a secure work environment with your team?

data.name: Introduction2MailText20
data.value: By 2025, the global email encryption market is anticipated to reach $12.9 billion, representing a 20.1 percent increase.

data.name: Introduction2MailText21
data.value: The frequency of cyberattacks has risen to 11 seconds in 2021, and ransomware damage costs rose 57 times more than in 2015.

data.name: Introduction2MailText22
data.value: With AxCrypt, you can avoid becoming a victim of a cyberattack.

data.name: Introduction2MailText23
data.value: Check out our industry page to see how we serve different industries and what they say about us: https://www.axcrypt.net/industries

data.name: Introduction2MailText24
data.value: Read our latest blog post for more information on how to keep your data safe: https://www.axcrypt.net/blog

data.name: Introduction2MailText25
data.value: Contact us at support@axcrypt.net if you have any questions!

data.name: Introduction2MailText26
data.value: Follow Us on Our Social Media

data.name: Introduction2MailText3
data.value: AxCrypt Premium gives you access to a variety of features that help you protect your personal data. Use the discount code PREMIUM10 to get a 10% discount.

data.name: Introduction2MailText4
data.value: If you are looking to use AxCrypt for professional purposes then AxCrypt Business is a right plan for you. Upgrade now and work with your team in a safe and secure manner. Use the discount code BUSINESS15 to get a 15% discount.

data.name: ManageSubscriptionResellerInfo
data.value: This account is managed by a reseller. The reseller can add new users to the account and manage payments. Note: Resellers do NOT gain access to any encrypted information, including files secured with Master key.

data.name: MasterKeyApprovalInfo
data.value: If approved, Master key will be applied to encrypted files and possible to recover by business administrators. If you want to stop having Master key applied, you can leave the business at any time (this is done in your My AxCrypt ID page).

data.name: MasterKeyApprovedTitle
data.value: Master key approved

data.name: MasterKeyBlock1Heading
data.value: Master key introduction

data.name: MasterKeyBlock1Text1
data.value: Master key is a feature which enables business administrators to recover files of the business members.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock1Text2
data.value: Imagine an important financial document being encrypted after creating the yearly revenue report. During the following year a new financial team is put in place, and when it's time for the yearly report they realize the financial document the previous team used, is now encrypted with credentials no one has access to any longer.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock1Text3
data.value: Enter Master key! With Master key enabled, the administrators of the business can always recover any file encrypted by the business members. In the above case the new financial team just has to ask their administrator and the financial document can easily be recovered, even if the original user left the company.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock1Text4
data.value: As long as the business has one or a couple administrators who make sure to keep track of their credentials, no files will ever be lost due to employees leaving or forgetting their passwords.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock2Heading
data.value: Master key and security

data.name: MasterKeyBlock2Text1
data.value: When enabling master key, business administrators can recover any document encrypted by their members. This, as mentioned, eliminates the risk of losing access to critical files. But is it secure?

data.name: MasterKeyBlock2Text2
data.value: In terms of security, you can view Master key as an automatic sharing of files with the administrators of the business. Administrators will automatically be able to recover files which has their Master key applied. This is no less secure than simply using AxCrypt's tried and tested Key Sharing feature.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock2Text3
data.value: Of course, business administrators need to be extra careful to choose good passwords and keeping their account safe at all times.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock3Heading
data.value: Enabling master key

data.name: MasterKeyBlock3Text1
data.value: Master key can be enabled from the manage subscription page.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock3Text2
data.value: After enabling Master key, all existing member of the business have to approve the change. This is an important security consideration, an existing user should never feel like this feature was hidden from them. Who has accepted the Master key feature can be seen in the user table.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock3Text3
data.value: If a user has not accepted Master key, it will not be applied to files they encrypt, so make sure everyone in your business accepts the feature.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock3Text4
data.value: Note! Files encrypted before enabling Master key will of course not be possible to recover. Old files have to be re-encrypted after the user having accepted master key.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock3Text5
data.value: For new businesses, or new members of existing businesses, Master key will be automatically approved when members joins the business.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock4Heading
data.value: Using Master Key

data.name: MasterKeyBlock4Text1
data.value: Once Master key has been enabled, it will be automatically applied to all files encrypted by members of the business. You can see if Master key has been applied by the Master key icon shown in the application.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock4Text2
data.value: If a file has this icon, then any business administrator can recover the file.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock4Text3
data.value: That's it! As you can see, Master key is very easy to use and nothing your business member ever have to consider or spend time on.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock4Text4
data.value: Please note that even though business administrators can recover files using Master key, this should not be used in normal usage. If a file is intended to be opened by a business administrator, then the file should Key shared with that user, just as with any other user.

data.name: MasterKeyBlock5Heading
data.value: Need more help?

data.name: MasterKeyBlock5Text1
data.value: Our priority business support is always standing by to help with any questions or concerns. Use the form on your account page, or send us a mail at business@axcrypt.net and we'll help you out!

data.name: MasterKeyBusinessHelpInfo1
data.value: Use the checkbox below to make it possible for AxCrypt to help recover files in case business administrators forgets their password. This should only be used upon explicit request for a verified business administrator!

data.name: MasterKeyBusinessHelpInfo2
data.value: This feature makes it possible for AxCrypt to recover files encrypted by members of this business. It should only be applied on explicit request by the business!

data.name: MasterKeyBusinessHelpPrompt
data.value: AxCrypt Recovery Backup

data.name: MasterKeyDescription
data.value: Enable business administrators to recover lost files

data.name: MasterKeyDisableHelpText
data.value: If Master key is disabled, business administrators will not be able to open files encrypted by their business members.

data.name: MasterKeyHelpText1
data.value: Master key enables business administrators to open files encrypted by the members of the business. Note, the member first has to approve master key before it being applied to their files. You can see who has approved master key in the user table. For more information, click here.

data.name: MasterKeyHelpText2
data.value: Files which were encrypted before enabling master key will not be possible to open without the original encryption credentials.

data.name: MasterKeyInfoPopupText
data.value: Master key is enabled. This means your business administrators can recover your secured files.
data.comment: Inform all the desktop users about the master key feature.

data.name: MasterKeyOldEncryptedFilesHelpText
data.value: Files encrypted before this will not be possible to recover with master key. If you know there are files you need to have master key applied to please inform the user to stop protecting the files and then start protecting them again. This will re-encrypt the files, including the master key.

data.name: MasterKeyRemovedWarningText
data.value: This file had a master key applied to it. Since you're not part of the same business, master key will be cleared from this file.

data.name: MasterKeyTitle
data.value: Master Key

data.name: Meta-Description-Aboutus
data.value: Read more about our award-winning, simple and reliable encryption software and our vision.

data.name: Meta-Description-Blog
data.value: Read blogs on encryption, data security, how AxCrypt helps in securing your data and learn ways to protect yourself and your business from cyber threats.

data.name: Meta-Description-Business
data.value: Protect, share and store your files and passwords with AxCrypt business share key and password manager feature. Multiple languages and devices are supported.

data.name: Meta-Description-Download
data.value: Get AxCrypt With 256-bit encryption to protect your files on local and cloud storage. Download for Android, Windows, iOS and Mac. Get a free trial.

data.name: Meta-Description-Education
data.value: All your educational documents need protection too. Secure student data, essays, papers, test answers and research results. Get protected against all data threats.

data.name: Meta-Description-Faq
data.value: Looking for answers to general or specific needs? Click on the support button for all answers to your questions.

data.name: Meta-Description-Features
data.value: Find out more about our features and supported operating systems. We also have some user tips available and more about your safety on the app

data.name: Meta-Description-Financial
data.value: Secure your passwords, financial information and eliminate the risk of losing access to critical files. Only authorized users can access it.

data.name: Meta-Description-Getstarted
data.value: Lets guide you to get started on the AxCrypt app and show you how to download and use the app on your devices.

data.name: Meta-Description-Government
data.value: As a government you can rely on AxCrypt to counter threats from a wide range of actors, criminals, foreign intelligence and repressive governments.

data.name: Meta-Description-Healthcare
data.value: AxCrypt offers an easy and simple user experience to protect patients health information, electronic health records and proper dosage amounts for medicine.

data.name: Meta-Description-Home
data.value: Easy to use advanced file encryption software for your business and personal data with cloud storage, mobile encryption and password manager. Get a free trial now

data.name: Meta-Description-Industries
data.value: AxCrypt 256-Bit encryption software helps industries like tech, education, health, legal, finance many more. To take back full control of your data and experience digital trust.

data.name: Meta-Description-Legal
data.value: Protect and secure your legal contracts, client information, IP and other crucial documents that are at highest risk of breach.

data.name: Meta-Description-Premium
data.value: With AxCrypt Premium you can secure your personal files online, automatically encrypt them with advanced encryption standard.

data.name: Meta-Description-Pricing
data.value: AxCrypt Premium USD 5/month and USD 45/year. Business USD 12/month and USD 119/year. One month free trial.

data.name: Meta-Description-Privacypolicy
data.value: We respect your privacy and have put strict measures in place for your safety on the AxCrypt app.

data.name: Meta-Description-Reseller
data.value: With the AxCrypt reseller program you can help your valuable customers to protect and safeguard their data. Join us today and avail the great benefits.

data.name: PasswordGeneratorText1
data.value: Creating good passwords is hard. There are many tips and tricks on the Internet on how to do this manually, and there are also automatic password generators available. Some are good, some are less so.

data.name: PasswordGeneratorText2
data.value: The AxCrypt Password Generator is different. Based on statistical analysis of actual text, it produces strong passwords that are not nonsensical and actually possible to remember and type. Try it out by clicking the button below. You’ll get three suggestions of decreasing strength and complexity.

data.value: Manage all your passwords online in the cloud with AxCrypt Password Management, your online safety deposit for passwords, codes, pins, etc. Your passwords are stored in a securely encrypted archive and are available to you, and only you, anywhere at any time. [Collapse]... [Read more]

data.name: PasswordRulesInfo
data.value:
AxCrypt has a sophisticated password strength evaluator based on measuring the actual strength of the password. It must also be at least 8 effective characters long.
We evaluate the password by estimating the strength, which is based on how long and complex the password is.
The evaluation entirely disregards parts of the password that is recognized as being among the 1,000 most common passwords, as well as white space. For example the password 'secretX password Y 123456' is evaluated as just 'XY', since spaces, 'secret', 'password' and '123456' are ignored!
We classify the password in 4 categories of increasing strength, were we do not accept any password in the lowest category. The above example is not accepted for that reason.
data.comment: A text describing the rules for passwords for AxCrypt. Pure text. For HTML views, newlines must be replaced, and possibly wrap it with a CSS style.

data.name: PasswordRulesShortInfo
data.value:
AxCrypt uses an advanced dynamic password strength calculator.
White space, and parts that are equal to common passwords are ignored and do not add any strength.
data.comment: A shorter description of how password strength is evaluated.

data.comment: Status 'Red' We'll accept it, but it's really not a good idea!

data.name: PasswordStrengthStrongName

data.comment: Short displayed name of the "Strong" password status

data.name: PasswordStrengthStrongTip
data.value: Password is strong and good enough to recommend.
data.comment: Status 'Green'. This is a really good password!

data.name: PasswordStrengthUnacceptableName

data.name: PasswordStrengthUnacceptableTip
data.value: Password is too short or too similar to a common password to be acceptable.

data.name: PremiumFirstBodyHeading
data.value: AxCrypt Premium

data.name: PremiumFirstBodyText
data.value:
Interested in getting a subscription, but not sure if it fits your needs? You can enjoy 30 days of AxCrypt Premium for free.

With AxCrypt Premium, you have access to extended functionality and exciting features! Encrypt your files with AES-256 – the strongest of the AES algorithm. It is used globally to protect sensitive and classified information of all levels. Securing folders has never been easier, only taking a single click to automatically secure new files.

If you also need to share secured files with others, you will have key sharing to take care of that for you, even with access to cloud storage awareness in Dropbox, Google Drive, etc. With the AxCrypt mobile app, you can encrypt and decrypt files on your phone, from anywhere and at any time.

Want to save password in a safe and easy way? Use our password management and generator to keep all your passwords safe in the cloud.

Try it out to discover all the features and benefits it offers!

data.name: PremiumFirstBodyText1
data.value: Interested in getting a subscription, but not sure if it fits your needs? You can enjoy 30 days of AxCrypt Premium for free.

data.name: PremiumFirstBodyText2
data.value: With AxCrypt Premium, you have access to extended functionality and exciting features! Encrypt your files with AES-256 – the strongest of the AES algorithm. It is used globally to protect sensitive and classified information of all levels. Securing folders has never been easier, only taking a single click to automatically secure new files.

data.name: PremiumFirstBodyText3
data.value: If you also need to share secured files with others, you will have key sharing to take care of that for you, even with access to cloud storage awareness in Dropbox, Google Drive, etc. With the AxCrypt mobile app, you can encrypt and decrypt files on your phone, from anywhere and at any time.
